html: The Every Student Succeeds Act put states back in the driver’s seat for decisions on how to help their students, and I am eager to see what this new chapter holds for our nation’s students.
text: The Every Student Succeeds Act put states back in the driver’s seat for decisions on how to help their students, and I am eager to see what this new chapter holds for our nation’s students.

html: Today, we will hear specifically from additional three states who, based upon my review of the plans, have also taken advantage of the flexibility we encouraged under the law to design innovative plans.
text: Today, we will hear specifically from additional three states who, based upon my review of the plans, have also taken advantage of the flexibility we encouraged under the law to design innovative plans.

html: Last October, this Committee held a hearing to hear from the State education chiefs in three states, Tennessee, Louisiana, and New Mexico, that were among the best at making the most of the new law by designing innovative plans.
text: Last October, this Committee held a hearing to hear from the State education chiefs in three states, Tennessee, Louisiana, and New Mexico, that were among the best at making the most of the new law by designing innovative plans.

html: Under #ESSA, in order to receive over $18 billion in annual federal funding, states have the chance to design their own State plan that includes setting academic goals for students, measuring schools’ performance, and deciding how to fix failing schools.
text: Under #ESSA, in order to receive over $18 billion in annual federal funding, states have the chance to design their own State plan that includes setting academic goals for students, measuring schools’ performance, and deciding how to fix failing schools.

html: Today, I hope to hear how Nebraska, South Carolina, and Delaware are taking advantage of that opportunity.
text: Today, I hope to hear how Nebraska, South Carolina, and Delaware are taking advantage of that opportunity.

html: The Every Student Succeeds Act gave Tennessee, in @Mrs_C_Hines’ words, “a real opportunity for our state to build on the progress we’ve made and enact change, particularly in traditionally-underserved communities.”
text: The Every Student Succeeds Act gave Tennessee, in @Mrs_C_Hines’ words, “a real opportunity for our state to build on the progress we’ve made and enact change, particularly in traditionally-underserved communities.”

html: The consensus this Committee reached was: Continue the law’s important measurements of academic progress of students but restore to states what to do about that progress.
text: The consensus this Committee reached was: Continue the law’s important measurements of academic progress of students but restore to states what to do about that progress.

html: Reaching the point of fixing No Child Left Behind took seven years of Congressional efforts, 27 hearings, and a three day markup where this Committee considered 57 amendments.
text: Reaching the point of fixing No Child Left Behind took seven years of Congressional efforts, 27 hearings, and a three day markup where this Committee considered 57 amendments.

html: Mrs. Hines: “ESSA empowers Tennessee with the responsibility to decide how to close achievement gaps, improve schools and make sure that all our children succeed.”
text: Mrs. Hines: “ESSA empowers Tennessee with the responsibility to decide how to close achievement gaps, improve schools and make sure that all our children succeed.”

html: Mrs. Hines: “Unlike the previous federal education law, No Child Left Behind, #ESSA gives Tennessee more autonomy to design policies to meet the needs of our state’s students.”
text: Mrs. Hines: “Unlike the previous federal education law, No Child Left Behind, #ESSA gives Tennessee more autonomy to design policies to meet the needs of our state’s students.”

text: In an age when you can compare different prices and check a dozen reviews when shopping for a new BBQ grill, Americans should be able to know the cost of their health care.

html: While the private sector is largely leading the charge on making health care information more easily available, the federal government can also play a role to help patients, and witnesses today can inform Congress about steps we can take.
text: While the private sector is largely leading the charge on making health care information more easily available, the federal government can also play a role to help patients, and witnesses today can inform Congress about steps we can take.

html: As patients have shopped around for Lasik, the price started to dramatically decrease – it has gone down 75 percent over the last 15 years, according to @RandPaul.
text: As patients have shopped around for Lasik, the price started to dramatically decrease – it has gone down 75 percent over the last 15 years, according to @RandPaul.

html: .@RandPaul has talked about how, with an elective surgery such as Lasik, a patient is more likely to call doctors’ offices to find the best price, calling an average of four different doctors to find the best price for the corrective eye surgery.
text: .@RandPaul has talked about how, with an elective surgery such as Lasik, a patient is more likely to call doctors’ offices to find the best price, calling an average of four different doctors to find the best price for the corrective eye surgery.

html: Today’s hearing is an opportunity to learn how we can improve what information is easily available about the cost and quality of health care, so patients can make the best health care decisions for them, their families, and their wallets.
text: Today’s hearing is an opportunity to learn how we can improve what information is easily available about the cost and quality of health care, so patients can make the best health care decisions for them, their families, and their wallets.

html: This is true for everything else but not for health care – the cost of health care has remained in a black box.
text: This is true for everything else but not for health care – the cost of health care has remained in a black box.

html: The Internet has made it easier for consumers to know more about what they want to purchase before they actually buy it. You can easily read an online review and compare prices for everything from a coffee maker to a new car.

html: After using a website that compiled typical prices for medical care, he learned the same test would have cost just $550 in a doctor’s office. @SecAzar said that consumers are so in the dark they often feel “powerless.”
text: After using a website that compiled typical prices for medical care, he learned the same test would have cost just $550 in a doctor’s office. @SecAzar said that consumers are so in the dark they often feel “powerless.”

html: .@SecAzar recently told the story of his doctor ordering a routine echo cardio stress test. He was sent down the street and admitted to the hospital, where, after considerable effort on his part, he learned the test would cost him $3,500.
text: .@SecAzar recently told the story of his doctor ordering a routine echo cardio stress test. He was sent down the street and admitted to the hospital, where, after considerable effort on his part, he learned the test would cost him $3,500.

html: This spending is part of the so-called discretionary spending, which is roughly 29 percent of all federal spending and includes NIH, national defense, national parks, and national laboratories. So, funding for research is not the reason for the increasing federal debt.
text: This spending is part of the so-called discretionary spending, which is roughly 29 percent of all federal spending and includes NIH, national defense, national parks, and national laboratories. So, funding for research is not the reason for the increasing federal debt.

html: The second thing to keep in mind is that these large increases in funding for biomedical research and other increases for our national laboratories and other basic research are not the part of the federal budget that creates the huge national deficit.

html: Today, we expect the full Senate to approve an additional $2 billion increase to @NIH funding for next year. If the bill we hope the Senate approves today is signed into law, Congress will have increased funding for NIH by $9 billion since 2015 – a 30% increase.
text: Today, we expect the full Senate to approve an additional $2 billion increase to @NIH funding for next year. If the bill we hope the Senate approves today is signed into law, Congress will have increased funding for NIH by $9 billion since 2015 – a 30% increase.

html: In 2015 and 2016, Congress increased funding for NIH by $2 billion each year. And then in 2017, Congress increased funding for NIH by $3 billion, including $500 million to work on a non-addictive painkiller.

html: As we look at how to reduce health care costs, we should keep in mind that what may seem like a good idea or a magic bullet in Washington may actually result in something very different for doctors and nurses.
text: As we look at how to reduce health care costs, we should keep in mind that what may seem like a good idea or a magic bullet in Washington may actually result in something very different for doctors and nurses.

html: The Trump Administration has taken a look at what administrative tasks are required by the federal government and I am glad to see that @SeemaCMS & @CMSGov, which oversees Medicare & Medicaid, recently proposed streamlining many of the agency’s burdensome reporting requirements.
text: The Trump Administration has taken a look at what administrative tasks are required by the federal government and I am glad to see that @SeemaCMS & @CMSGov, which oversees Medicare & Medicaid, recently proposed streamlining many of the agency’s burdensome reporting requirements.

html: The average community hospital needs 23 full time employees just to keep up with the regulations about what a hospital needs to do to participate in Medicare – called “Conditions of Participation,” according to the @ahahospitals.
text: The average community hospital needs 23 full time employees just to keep up with the regulations about what a hospital needs to do to participate in Medicare – called “Conditions of Participation,” according to the @ahahospitals.

html: According to the @ahahospitals, there are 629 different regulatory requirements from four different federal agencies that doctors, hospitals, and other health care providers have to comply with.
text: According to the @ahahospitals, there are 629 different regulatory requirements from four different federal agencies that doctors, hospitals, and other health care providers have to comply with.

html: This is just one example of how well-intentioned ideas from Washington can turn out to add to the administrative burdens doctors face.
text: This is just one example of how well-intentioned ideas from Washington can turn out to add to the administrative burdens doctors face.

html: Unfortunately, electronic health records systems have ended up being something physicians too often dread, rather than a tool that’s useful.
text: Unfortunately, electronic health records systems have ended up being something physicians too often dread, rather than a tool that’s useful.

html: For example, there was a lot of excitement over electronic health records in Washington – many said these records systems would make it easier for doctors and patients to access a patient’s health records and share information with other doctors.
text: For example, there was a lot of excitement over electronic health records in Washington – many said these records systems would make it easier for doctors and patients to access a patient’s health records and share information with other doctors.

html: While many administrative tasks in the health care system come from outside the federal government—such as insurance company or state requirements—the federal government is clearly at fault for some of this burden.
text: While many administrative tasks in the health care system come from outside the federal government—such as insurance company or state requirements—the federal government is clearly at fault for some of this burden.

html: Administrative costs are much higher in the U.S. than in other countries. According to Dr. Ashish Jha, a witness at our first hearing, administrative costs accounted for 8% of all health care spending in the U.S., roughly that is $264B, compared to only 1%-3% for other countries.
text: Administrative costs are much higher in the U.S. than in other countries. According to Dr. Ashish Jha, a witness at our first hearing, administrative costs accounted for 8% of all health care spending in the U.S., roughly that is $264B, compared to only 1%-3% for other countries.

html: Today, we are examining the cost of administrative tasks – which includes everything from the time spent filling out insurance claims to buying software for an electronic health records system.
text: Today, we are examining the cost of administrative tasks – which includes everything from the time spent filling out insurance claims to buying software for an electronic health records system.

html: At our last hearing, we focused on reducing what we spend on health care by examining two things: one, on reducing unnecessary health care tests, services, procedures, and prescription drugs, and two, how to increase preventive care.
text: At our last hearing, we focused on reducing what we spend on health care by examining two things: one, on reducing unnecessary health care tests, services, procedures, and prescription drugs, and two, how to increase preventive care.

html: The hope is that with a modernized approach to apprenticeships, industries that weren’t around when Paul Revere was training to be a silversmith or even when Elvis was learning to be an electrician, would be able to start apprenticeship programs.
text: The hope is that with a modernized approach to apprenticeships, industries that weren’t around when Paul Revere was training to be a silversmith or even when Elvis was learning to be an electrician, would be able to start apprenticeship programs.

html: Another type of apprenticeship is an “Industry Recognized Apprenticeship.” These apprenticeships are an alternative to federally-registered apprenticeships, with more flexible requirements developed by industry and less administrative red tape.
text: Another type of apprenticeship is an “Industry Recognized Apprenticeship.” These apprenticeships are an alternative to federally-registered apprenticeships, with more flexible requirements developed by industry and less administrative red tape.

html: One way for workers to learn new skills is what we are looking at today: apprenticeships. Today, federally-registered apprenticeships are especially concentrated in industries like construction and manufacturing, and work well for many employers and workers.

html: We need to find ways to improve care and maximize the quality of the health care patients do receive by looking at what medical tests, services, procedures, or medications are really necessary or if there are more cost effective alternatives.
text: We need to find ways to improve care and maximize the quality of the health care patients do receive by looking at what medical tests, services, procedures, or medications are really necessary or if there are more cost effective alternatives.

html: Unnecessary spending is a burden on the health care system and on the patients who undergo tests and procedures that may not be medically necessary – and who are then stuck with the bill.
text: Unnecessary spending is a burden on the health care system and on the patients who undergo tests and procedures that may not be medically necessary – and who are then stuck with the bill.

html: And second: The lack of preventive care, which results in spending money on health care services that could have been avoided if the patient had received care earlier.
text: And second: The lack of preventive care, which results in spending money on health care services that could have been avoided if the patient had received care earlier.

html: Today, we will discuss two of these categories of wasteful spending: First, unnecessary spending, which does not actually help patients get better or was spent on unnecessary medical tests, services, procedures, or medications.
text: Today, we will discuss two of these categories of wasteful spending: First, unnecessary spending, which does not actually help patients get better or was spent on unnecessary medical tests, services, procedures, or medications.

html: According to the @theNASEM in 2009 there was $750 billion in wasted health care spending, or as much as 30 percent of our total health care spending.
text: According to the @theNASEM in 2009 there was $750 billion in wasted health care spending, or as much as 30 percent of our total health care spending.

html: Our focus today is on reducing wasted health care spending, which is important given the estimated amount we spend on unnecessary services, excessive administrative costs, fraud, and other problems is a great, big number.
text: Our focus today is on reducing wasted health care spending, which is important given the estimated amount we spend on unnecessary services, excessive administrative costs, fraud, and other problems is a great, big number.

html: Today we will take the first step toward reducing health care costs by understanding the cost of health care – to taxpayers, employers, and individuals like Todd.
text: Today we will take the first step toward reducing health care costs by understanding the cost of health care – to taxpayers, employers, and individuals like Todd.

html: So, Todd was surprised when he received a bill for $1800 – because even though the emergency room was “in-network,” the doctor who treated his son was not.
text: So, Todd was surprised when he received a bill for $1800 – because even though the emergency room was “in-network,” the doctor who treated his son was not.

html: That is what I heard from Todd, a Knoxville father, who recently took his son to an emergency room after a bicycle accident. His son was treated, Todd paid a $150 copay because the emergency room was “in-network” for his health insurance, and they headed home.
text: That is what I heard from Todd, a Knoxville father, who recently took his son to an emergency room after a bicycle accident. His son was treated, Todd paid a $150 copay because the emergency room was “in-network” for his health insurance, and they headed home.

html: The average American is shocked by the cost of their health care. They don’t understand what they are being charged for and why it costs so much, and they want better answers.
text: The average American is shocked by the cost of their health care. They don’t understand what they are being charged for and why it costs so much, and they want better answers.

html: The most obvious fact about health care costs, other than that they’re too high, is that they are indecipherable. Any one of us who has received a hospital bill in the mail or has tried to figure out their health insurance benefits has wondered what it all means.
text: The most obvious fact about health care costs, other than that they’re too high, is that they are indecipherable. Any one of us who has received a hospital bill in the mail or has tried to figure out their health insurance benefits has wondered what it all means.

html: The first step to reducing health care costs is to better understand the cost of health care in America and understand why health care in America costs so much more than it does in other countries.
text: The first step to reducing health care costs is to better understand the cost of health care in America and understand why health care in America costs so much more than it does in other countries.

html: Warren Buffett has called the ballooning costs of health care…“a hungry tapeworm on the American economy.”
text: Warren Buffett has called the ballooning costs of health care…“a hungry tapeworm on the American economy.”

html: According to the Assistant Secretary for Planning and Evaluation at the @HHSGov, which is the health data office at HHS, we spent $2.2 trillion dollars on health care in 2006. This is projected to grow to $5.7 trillion in 2026 – that is a 159 percent increase.
text: According to the Assistant Secretary for Planning and Evaluation at the @HHSGov, which is the health data office at HHS, we spent $2.2 trillion dollars on health care in 2006. This is projected to grow to $5.7 trillion in 2026 – that is a 159 percent increase.

html: So today, we are beginning a series of hearings looking at how to reduce health care costs, including examining administrative costs, waste, how to improve transparency, private sector solutions, and other important issues as they come up.
text: So today, we are beginning a series of hearings looking at how to reduce health care costs, including examining administrative costs, waste, how to improve transparency, private sector solutions, and other important issues as they come up.

html: But, the hard truth is that we will never get the cost of health insurance down until we get the cost of health care down.
text: But, the hard truth is that we will never get the cost of health insurance down until we get the cost of health care down.

html: For the last seven years, Republicans and Democrats have been locked in a debate over health insurance, primarily the individual insurance market, which is important but is where only six percent of insured Americans get their health insurance.
text: For the last seven years, Republicans and Democrats have been locked in a debate over health insurance, primarily the individual insurance market, which is important but is where only six percent of insured Americans get their health insurance.

html: Association health plans would be required to comply with the same patient protections as plans at larger companies, including prohibitions against charging more or denying coverage because of a preexisting condition.
text: Association health plans would be required to comply with the same patient protections as plans at larger companies, including prohibitions against charging more or denying coverage because of a preexisting condition.

html: Data is necessary to demonstrate the value of the 340B Program, and Congress cannot evaluate the program, conduct oversight, or consider changes to improve the program without more information.
text: Data is necessary to demonstrate the value of the 340B Program, and Congress cannot evaluate the program, conduct oversight, or consider changes to improve the program without more information.

html: We learned at our two previous hearings on the program, there is no consistent data that shows how hospitals and clinics are spending the money they save through the 340B Program.
text: We learned at our two previous hearings on the program, there is no consistent data that shows how hospitals and clinics are spending the money they save through the 340B Program.

html: Some of the time, the 340B discount is passed directly to the patient as a lower priced drug. Other times, the hospital or clinic uses the savings to provide other services to patients like the programs Methodist, Saint Thomas, and Erlanger run.
text: Some of the time, the 340B discount is passed directly to the patient as a lower priced drug. Other times, the hospital or clinic uses the savings to provide other services to patients like the programs Methodist, Saint Thomas, and Erlanger run.

html: They are all able to provide these services because of the money they save by participating in the 340B Drug Pricing Program, which requires drug manufacturers that participate in Medicaid to provide discounts on prescriptions drugs to qualifying hospitals and clinics.
text: They are all able to provide these services because of the money they save by participating in the 340B Drug Pricing Program, which requires drug manufacturers that participate in Medicaid to provide discounts on prescriptions drugs to qualifying hospitals and clinics.

html: And, Erlanger Health System in Chattanooga delivers prescription drugs at no cost to low-income patients at their homes, to ensure they are receiving and taking their medications.
text: And, Erlanger Health System in Chattanooga delivers prescription drugs at no cost to low-income patients at their homes, to ensure they are receiving and taking their medications.

html: Saint Thomas Health in Nashville operates four Dispensary of Hope pharmacy sites across the state of Tennessee, providing low-income, uninsured patients with free or low-cost prescription drugs.
text: Saint Thomas Health in Nashville operates four Dispensary of Hope pharmacy sites across the state of Tennessee, providing low-income, uninsured patients with free or low-cost prescription drugs.

html: We need to know if what the federal government currently is doing is effective or if specific improvements should be made. Do we need all of these programs, or should there be changes to better meet the needs of patients?
text: We need to know if what the federal government currently is doing is effective or if specific improvements should be made. Do we need all of these programs, or should there be changes to better meet the needs of patients?

html: And finally, we spend about $310 million for the National Health Service Corps, which provides loan repayment for primary care doctors who go to work in under-served areas. Most of these doctors choose to work at the 10,000 community health centers across the country.
text: And finally, we spend about $310 million for the National Health Service Corps, which provides loan repayment for primary care doctors who go to work in under-served areas.  Most of these doctors choose to work at the 10,000 community health centers across the country.

html: Second, we spend over $1B on about 70 different health workforce programs that provide scholarships and loan repayment for students, faculty, and health care professionals in exchange for working in rural areas. All of these programs are within the HELP committee’s jurisdiction.
text: Second, we spend over $1B on about 70 different health workforce programs that provide scholarships and loan repayment for students, faculty, and health care professionals in exchange for working in rural areas. All of these programs are within the HELP committee’s jurisdiction.

html: First, about $10 billion goes to Medicare Graduate Medical Education Programs, which funds resident training for new doctors. That program is in the jurisdiction of the Finance committee
text: First, about $10 billion goes to Medicare Graduate Medical Education Programs, which funds resident training for new doctors. That program is in the jurisdiction of the Finance committee

html: The federal government is currently doing three things to help reduce and prevent shortages of health care workers.
text: The federal government is currently doing three things to help reduce and prevent shortages of health care workers.

html: The shortage affects certain populations more than others. In 2014, the @acognews reported that 47 rural Tennessee counties, out of 95 total, had no OB-GYN. That means a couple may have to travel to Memphis, Nashville or Knoxville to see an OB-GYN.
text: The shortage affects certain populations more than others. In 2014, the @acognews reported that 47 rural Tennessee counties, out of 95 total, had no OB-GYN. That means a couple may have to travel to Memphis, Nashville or Knoxville to see an OB-GYN.

html: According to the @ruralhealth, there are only 39 primary care doctors for every 100,000 people living in rural areas, but there are 53 primary care doctors for every 100,000 people in urban areas.
text: According to the @ruralhealth, there are only 39 primary care doctors for every 100,000 people living in rural areas, but there are 53 primary care doctors for every 100,000 people in urban areas.

html: We know that the shortage of health care professionals – which includes doctors, nurses, paramedics, and x-ray technicians – is a problem that has the potential to keep getting worse.
text: We know that the shortage of health care professionals – which includes doctors, nurses, paramedics, and x-ray technicians – is a problem that has the potential to keep getting worse.

html: Today’s bipartisan hearing is an opportunity to learn about the growing shortage of health care professionals – especially in rural areas – and better understand where health care professionals are choosing to work so we can start addressing shortages across the country.
text: Today’s bipartisan hearing is an opportunity to learn about the growing shortage of health care professionals – especially in rural areas – and better understand where health care professionals are choosing to work so we can start addressing shortages across the country.

html: Last week the Senate passed the Firefighter Cancer Registry Act of 2017. This legislation, which creates a voluntary firefighter cancer registry at the @CDCgov, will support research to improve cancer treatment and prevention for firefighters.
